subject: Re: [junit] automatic test suite creation
msgSnippet: ... I can t remember which one it was, but there was a tip on http://www.javaworld.com on how to do this. A quick search for junit should throw it up. HTH, Jim
messageBody:
At 04:53 PM 3/26/2001, you wrote:

>Hi everyone,
>
>I'm having trouble remembering to update my AllTests.suite() method every
>time I create a new TestCase subclass. (I use this class to run all the unit
>tests in my project). This is rather annoying, and I read somewhere that
>there is a tool for automatically creating test suites, rather than
>maintaining a class like this by hand. As I remember, it was a case of
>pointing this tool at your classpath and it would go away and find all your
>test classes and create a suite for them. Does such a tool exist? Can anyone
>tell me where I can get it? I had a look around junit.org but I couldn't see
>anything like it.


I can't remember which one it was, but there was a tip on
http://www.javaworld.com on how to do this.
A quick search for junit should throw it up.


HTH,
Jim
